intro: Gagea smyrnaea, commonly known as the Smyrna gagea, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, grass-like foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces a single, elongated, cylindrical bulb that serves as its primary storage organ. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and woodland settings. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
